unnormalised: ## Beyond the Blockbuster: Why Film Festivals are a Must-Do for Every Cinephile
normalised: ## Beyond the Blockbuster: Why Film Festivals are a Must-Do for Every Cinephile

unnormalised: Hey fellow movie buffs! Ever feel like Bollywood masala and Hollywood explosions are all there is to the world of cinema? I get it. Sometimes you just crave something *more*. Something that digs a little deeper, tells a different story, and introduces you to voices you've never heard before. That's where film festivals come in!

unnormalised: Think of film festivals as curated journeys into the heart of storytelling. They’re not just about premieres and red carpets (though those are fun too!), they're about discovering hidden gems, supporting independent filmmakers, and engaging in conversations about art and culture.
normalised: Think of film festivals as curated journeys into the heart of storytelling. They’re not just about premieres and red carpets (though those are fun too!), they're about discovering hidden gems, supporting independent filmmakers, and engaging in conversations about art and culture.

unnormalised: India has some fantastic film festivals! From the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa – a classic that attracts filmmakers from across the globe - to smaller, regional fests showcasing local talent, there's something for everyone. I remember attending the Pune International Film Festival (PIFF) a few years back. I caught a screening of a low-budget Marathi film that blew me away. It was raw, honest, and tackled social issues with a depth I hadn't seen in mainstream Bollywood for ages. No item numbers, just pure, unfiltered storytelling. Reminded me of the kind of raw storytelling in early Anurag Kashyap films.

unnormalised: These festivals aren't just for industry professionals either. Many offer public screenings, workshops, and Q&A sessions with directors and actors. You might even find yourself debating the merits of a film with a renowned critic over a cup of chai!

unnormalised: Attending a film festival is an experience. It's a chance to broaden your horizons, meet passionate people, and see the world through a different lens. Maybe you'll even discover the next big thing in Indian cinema, or simply find a new favorite film that stays with you long after the credits roll. So, next time you're looking for something to do, skip the multiplex and check out your local film festival. You might just be surprised at what you find. Plus, you can usually find tickets for around Rs. 200-500 per screening, depending on the festival. Definitely worth the price! Many film festivals are held in places within a 500km radius. Go find one and let me know what you discover!
